items.summary: The sports minister has endured scrutiny over her use of parliamentary expenses, but is one of dozens of MPs to have accumulated large Comcar bills.

items.title: Domestic violence survivors using strength training for trauma recovery
items.summary: In a suburban Canberra gym, no questions are asked. If you identify as a domestic violence survivor, you're in. The WEST Project is an innovative program helping women build themselves back up through powerlifting.

items.title: A logical gas exports policy could put the economy back on an even keel
items.summary: For a decade, a disaster has unfolded. We've run short of gas through indecision and incompetence, and that's driving energy costs and inflation. We need a solution and an unlikely source may have one.

items.title: Fluke discoveries of asbestos in children's sand strike twice decades apart
items.summary: A doctor in the US who found asbestos in his son's sandpit tried in vain to get stronger regulations. Almost 40 years later he says he's "not surprised" the problem re-emerged in Australia.

items.title: For some teenagers, 'life is better' without social media and they support the ban
items.summary: Patrick, 15, does not use social media and hopes he never does. Nick, 15, had a flip phone for the first few years of high school. Here is why they support the social media ban.

items.title: Australia's favourite political test depends on who is at the pub
items.summary: The "pub test" tends to be applied when we've run out of avenues to pursue a public figure, but are still super annoyed.

items.title: Today in History, December 9: How smallpox was eradicated after killing 300 million people in the 20th century
items.summary: The eradication of smallpox 46 years ago has been hailed as the greatest triumph of global public health. It has also been held up as a model for global cooperation.

items.title: Jacob Elordi, Rose Byrne and Joel Edgerton score Golden Globes nominations
items.summary: Jacob Elordi is Australia's big hope at the Golden Globes after scoring two nominations overnight for the 83rd iteration of the film and television awards.

items.title: Magnitude-7.6 earthquake in Japan prompts tsunami warning and evacuation order for 90,000 people
items.summary: The quake has seen a tsunami warning issued for large parts of Japan's northern coastline and about 90,000 people ordered to evacuate to higher ground.

items.title: Renters need $300,000 more superannuation in retirement than home owners, report finds
items.summary: Rising rents mean older Australians who are not home owners will need twice as much superannuation to enjoy the same retirement lifestyle as those who are mortgage-free, according to a study by a leading advocacy group.

items.title: Ellenbrook Secondary School in lockdown after student stabbed in knife attack
items.summary: A teenage boy is taken to hospital after being stabbed in the arm in a "targeted" knife attack that saw a Perth high school go into lockdown on Monday afternoon.

items.title: Clermont's only GP clinic closes after hospital doctor suspended
items.summary: The suspension of Tim Lane leaves a Central Queensland town of 3,000 people with no permanent hospital doctor or GP.

items.title: Perth boy's death in Department of Communities care may have been accidental, inquest told
items.summary: An inquest hears the 2024 death of a 10-year-old Indigenous boy while he was under the care of the Department of Communities may have been an accident, not suicide.

items.title: Monday Finance with Alan Kohler
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: NRL proposes lengthy bans for Tonga officials following Eli Katoa head knocks
items.summary: Three Tonga team officials are facing two-year suspensions following the NRL's investigation into the incident that forced Eli Katoa out of the 2026 season.

items.title: NSW man jailed over single-vehicle crash that killed three friends near Tarago
items.summary: A young driver who crashed his car near Tarago, killing his girlfriend and two friends, has been sentenced to more than six years in jail.

items.title: More than 30 zinc sunscreen brands using formula that failed preliminary SPF testing
items.summary: It's been almost two years since Craig Jones first ran preliminary tests on his zinc sunscreen. When he discovered it wasn't providing the SPF it was supposed to he threw it out and set out on a quest to find out why.

items.title: Trump hosts Kennedy Center Honors in historic first
items.summary: Donald Trump has made the Kennedy Center a touchstone in a broader attack against what he claims is "woke", anti-American culture.

items.title: Should you go screen-free after giving birth? These mums share their stories
items.summary: Readers share how they approached their online and social media use in the weeks immediately after giving birth.

items.title: Australian Ashes openers Travis Head and Jake Weatherald praised as Usman Khawaja call looms
items.summary: Marnus Labuschagne says Australia's opening partnership is making the rest of the batting order improve, as selectors deliberate over Usman Khawaja's Test future.

items.title: Goldfields man in coma after allegedly smashing head into ambulance windscreen
items.summary: A 25-year-old man is in a coma and cannot attend court after he allegedly smashed an ambulance windscreen with his head while naked.

items.title: Perth man Adam Simon McGovern guilty of making 'upskirt' videos of women, girls
items.summary: A man who made 'upskirt' videos of women and girls in public places in Perth is found guilty of multiple charges.

items.title: Dolphin Sands resident 'frustrated' by official communication after bushfire destroys homes
items.summary: More questions have been raised about the official warnings ahead of a bushfire that destroyed 19 homes in a tiny Tasmanian seaside community where there is one road in and out.

items.title: Queensland man charged with allegedly displaying Nazi symbols
items.summary: Police allege the 43-year-old UK citizen was advocating for violence online and had swords bearing swastika symbols seized from his Queensland home.

items.title: Coalition puts heat on Wells over trips to cricket and AFL with family
items.summary: The Coalition is applying more heat to Sport Minister Anika Wells over flights she claimed for herself and her husband to attend two Boxing Day cricket test matches in recent years, and several AFL Grand Final events.

items.title: Police charge 18-year-old man allegedly involved in fatal Ascot Vale stabbing
items.summary: Police charge an 18-year-old man with offences including intentionally causing injury and affray, following the incident that claimed the life of a 40-year-old in Ascot Vale on Sunday afternoon.

items.title: One of PNG's rare conjoined twins dies after urgent surgery in Sydney, brother survives
items.summary: Surgeons have separated a rare set of conjoined twins after they were urgently flown from Papua New Guinea to Australia, but only one of the boys has survived.

items.title: Men jailed for gang raping women at Newcastle bucks weekend have convictions quashed
items.summary: Marius Hawell, his brother and a friend have had their convictions thrown out on grounds of appeal, after being handed jail sentences of between nine and 14 years.

items.title: Government will not extend energy bill relief
items.summary: Jim Chalmers says the end to the "temporary" subsidy was a "hard" decision but recognises pressures on the budget.

items.title: England's lack of Ashes depth highlighted as Australia A thumps Lions at Allan Border Field
items.summary: England's lack of Test depth is highlighted as Australia A beats the Lions by an innings and 127 runs.

items.title: Barnaby Joyce joins One Nation, concluding defection from Nationals
items.summary: Barnaby Joyce's defection gives One Nation its first lower house seat since 1998.

items.title: Water leak at the Louvre museum damages hundreds of works
items.summary: The leak occurred after a valve was accidentally opened in a heating and ventilation system, allowing water to seep through the ceiling of the Mollien wing.

items.title: Cleveland Dodd's care in Unit 18 'inhumane', coroner examining youth detention death finds
items.summary: Western Australia's first recorded death in youth detention was predictable, a coroner finds, declaring the care of 16-year-old Cleveland Dodd was "inhumane" and "reminiscent of 19th century jails". WARNING: This story contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.

items.title: How would your feed look if you got to control what you saw on social media?
items.summary: Sexual violence prevention group Teach Us Consent is pushing for Australians to have the choice to "opt-in" to social media algorithms.

items.title: City of Rockingham residents complain of maggots and flies after FOGO introduction
items.summary: Perth residents say they are dealing with an "infestation of maggots" and stinking rubbish after the introduction of a third bin for food and garden waste. But the local council is adamant it will not be making any changes.

items.title: Brendon McCullum says England 'over-prepared' ahead of Brisbane Test, as players head to Noosa
items.summary: England coach Brendon McCullum claims his team trained too hard for the Gabba Test, which ended in a bruising eight-wicket loss that leaves the tourists' Ashes hopes in tatters.

items.title: How the internet reacted to Australia winning the second Ashes Test
items.summary: Mitchell Starc was the hero, again, as the English were comprehensively outplayed in Brisbane — but how did the internet react?

items.title: Hitchhiking Pilbara mechanic Kevin Guiness recounts a lifetime on the road
items.summary: At 12 years old, Kevin Guiness was rebuilding engines on an outback cattle station. Now, after decades travelling the dusty roads in the Pilbara, the Yindjibarndi elder reflects on what kept him going.

items.title: New NT training program aims to attract and keep home tutors at remote stations
items.summary: A course offered for the first time this year has upskilled home tutors working on remote central Australian cattle stations in a bid to ease education workforce shortages in the outback.

items.title: 59yo NPWS firefighter killed by falling tree during bushfire prevention work at Nerong
items.summary: A National Parks and Wildlife Service firefighter dies after being crushed by a tree during bushfire prevention work north of Newcastle.

items.title: Protesters mount legal challenge to Victoria Police designated area declaration for Melbourne
items.summary: A legal challenge is launched against a "designated area" declaration for Melbourne's CBD that gives police greater powers to search people without a warrant.

items.title: Murray-Darling Basin predicted to be hotter and drier by 2050 if nothing changes
items.summary: Water needs for river communities will be under increasing pressure over the next 25 years, according to predictions from the Murray-Darling Basin Authority.

items.title: Where Oscar Piastri lost the Formula 1 world championship, McLaren teammate Lando Norris claims ultimate prize
items.summary: Oscar Piastri missed out on winning the Formula 1 drivers world championship by just 13 points to his teammate Lando Norris, the culmination of multiple small moments throughout the season that cost him dearly.

items.title: Victoria Police apologises for misgendering trans woman after two-year legal battle
items.summary: Victoria Police fought a legal battle with a transgender woman for more than two years before admitting it incorrectly referred her to men's support services.

items.title: Health regulator accused of failing to support patients amid complaints over doctors' conduct
items.summary: Two women have told the ABC they believe the health regulator is failing to acknowledge the power imbalance between doctors and patients.

items.title: Muster Dogs favourite Frank Finger makes final on-screen appearance with kelpie Annie in portrait show
items.summary: From hit series Muster Dogs to a new television show, Frank Finger and his beloved kelpie Annie's unbreakable bond steals the spotlight once again.

items.title: Crops preferred to sheep in large parts of Australia's traditional mixed farming regions
items.summary: Mixed farming, which involves growing crops and rearing livestock, used to be standard practice in Australia, but there are almost 100 million fewer sheep in Australia than there were 35 years ago.

items.title: Anika Wells's taxpayer-funded Thredbo ski trip a costly distraction for Labor
items.summary: What was meant to be a Sunday interview bookending a remarkable political year became an exercise in explaining the inexplicable.

items.title: Exploitation fears over SA government aged care changes
items.summary: The South Australian government is trying to speed up the transfer of hospital patients into aged care, but advocates say they are "trampling on the rights of older people" in the process.

items.title: China's global technology and engineering ascendancy continues
items.summary: China used to be trying to catch the West, specifically the US. Then it caught up. Now the West is trying to catch up to China, but likely can't.

items.title: Russia increases recruitment of foreign fighters through targeted social media campaigns
items.summary: Through a targeted social media campaign, Russia is offering citizenship and money to foreigners who join its fight in Ukraine, but experts say it is a desperate measure.

items.title: Communities harness the people power of co-ops to stave off privatisation
items.summary: For its passionate members, saving a historic goldrush-era pub to protect their cooperative was about "economic democracy" and keeping the property out of developers' hands.

items.title: How Europe is gearing up to follow Australia's teen social media ban
items.summary: The European Union says it will learn from Australia's new laws to bar under-16s from social media, with steps to implement the world-first ban already underway and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen praising Australia's "brave move".

items.title: Devastated families grapple with ferocity of NSW Central Coast bushfires
items.summary: Residents on the NSW coast are coming to terms with property loss after bushfires swept through the region on Saturday.

items.title: Have you been involved in a multi-level marketing business? Tell us your MLM story
items.summary: Multi-level marketing networks have been around for decades. But their business models are changing, with consumer advocates warning that the industry is rife with predatory tactics. We want to hear about your experiences with MLMs.

items.title: Australia and Steve Smith chase total Ashes domination as England pokes the bear in Brisbane
items.summary: The snarl on Steve Smith's face proves conclusively that Australia doesn't just want to beat the English in this Ashes series. It wants to break them.

items.title: Is it ever OK to leave a party or social event without saying goodbye?
items.summary: We asked two experts for their advice on the etiquette of leaving a social gathering without notice and the best approaches to take if you do need to depart suddenly.

items.title: Ben Stokes questions England's ability to handle Ashes pressure as Brendon McCullum warns of 'glass jaw'
items.summary: England's famed captain-coach duo aren't going to let their relationship fray in the face of the biggest test of their polarising tenure.

items.title: Smith fires up, Bazball leaves the building and a miraculous grab — quick hits from day four of the Gabba Ashes Test
items.summary: Smith "champs" Archer, Bazball leaves the building and the Australian captain breaks the game open with a miraculous grab. Here are the quick hits from the fourth and final day of the Gabba Ashes Test.

items.title: Japan and Australia urge calm after Chinese radar locks onto Japanese jets
items.summary: Japan formally protests the incident, calling it "an extremely regrettable" and dangerous act that "exceeded the scope necessary for safe aircraft operations".

items.title: Man smashes ambulance windscreen with head in Kalgoorlie-Boulder
items.summary: A video circulated on social media shows a naked male using his head to smash the windscreen of a moving ambulance.

items.title: Teenager arrested, police search for second person after fatal Ascot Vale stabbing
items.summary: Police are seeking out witnesses and searching for a second person believed to be involved in the fatal stabbing of a man in Melbourne's north.

items.title: Sydney Sixers sneak home in final-ball thriller against Adelaide Strikers to secure WBBL finals spot
items.summary: Ellyse Perry produced one of the best knocks of her career but the Sydney Sixers took until the final ball to see off the Adelaide Strikers and land a WBBL finals spot.
